channel.title: Homes on Lê-Huu, D. Khuê
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Lê-Huu, D. Khuê

item.description: Welcome Since April 2018, I am a researcher at Qopius Technology, a computer vision startup based in Paris. Prior to that, I was a PhD candidate in Computer Science at the Center for Visual Computing of CentraleSupélec and the GALEN–POST research team of Inria Saclay. I was advised by Professor Nikos Paragios. My research interests are in optimization methods for graphical models and neural networks.

item.title: Community activities
item.description: I have been a reviewer for the following journals: IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence (TPAMI). International Journal of Computer Vision (IJCV).

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I have been a teaching assistant and/or a guest lecturer for the following MSc programs of CentraleSupélec. MSc in Data Sciences & Business Analytics 2017-2018: Applied Mathematics (including Machine Learning, Statistics, Continuous and Discrete Optimization) MSc in Applied Mathematics: Vision and Learning 2017-2018: Discrete Inference and Learning 2016-2017: Introduction to Deep Learning 2015-2016: Machine Learning for Computer Vision 2014-2015: Machine Learning for Computer Vision
